title: Getting Started with roxigraph
text: roxigraph provides RDF storage SPARQL query capabilities R wrapping Oxigraph graph database. vignette introduces core functionality.

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
text: persistent storage survives R sessions:
code: library(roxigraph)  # Create an in-memory store store <- rdf_store() store <- rdf_store("/path/to/database")

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
text: roxigraph supports multiple RDF serialization formats:

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: turtle_data <- ' @prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> . @prefix ex: <http://example.org/> .  ex:alice a foaf:Person ;          foaf:name "Alice" ;          foaf:age 30 ;          foaf:knows ex:bob .  ex:bob a foaf:Person ;        foaf:name "Bob" ;        foaf:age 25 . '  rdf_load(store, turtle_data, format = "turtle") rdf_size(store) #> [1] 7

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: store2 <- rdf_store() nt_data <- '<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> "object" .' rdf_load(store2, nt_data, format = "ntriples")

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: rdf_load_file(store, "data.ttl", format = "turtle") rdf_load_file(store, "data.nt") # Format guessed from extension

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: # Find all people and their names results <- sparql_query(store, "   PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>   SELECT ?person ?name   WHERE {     ?person a foaf:Person ;             foaf:name ?name .   } ") results #>                       person    name #> 1   <http://example.org/bob>   "Bob" #> 2 <http://example.org/alice> "Alice"

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: # Find people over 26 sparql_query(store, "   PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>   SELECT ?name ?age   WHERE {     ?person foaf:name ?name ;             foaf:age ?age .     FILTER(?age > 26)   }   ORDER BY DESC(?age) ") #>      name                                              age #> 1 "Alice" "30"^^<http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#integer>

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: # Check if Alice exists sparql_query(store, "   PREFIX ex: <http://example.org/>   ASK { ex:alice ?p ?o } ") #> [1] TRUE

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: sparql_query(store, "   PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>   SELECT (COUNT(?person) as ?count) (AVG(?age) as ?avg_age)   WHERE {     ?person a foaf:Person ;             foaf:age ?age .   } ") #>                                             count #> 1 "2"^^<http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#integer> #>                                              avg_age #> 1 "27.5"^^<http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#decimal>

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: # Add new data sparql_update(store, "   PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>   PREFIX ex: <http://example.org/>    INSERT DATA {     ex:carol a foaf:Person ;              foaf:name 'Carol' ;              foaf:age 28 .   } ")  rdf_size(store) #> [1] 10

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
code: # Add a triple rdf_add(     store, "<http://example.org/carol>",     "<http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/knows>",     "<http://example.org/alice>" )  # Remove a triple rdf_remove(     store, "<http://example.org/carol>",     "<http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/knows>",     "<http://example.org/alice>" )

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
text: Export RDF data: Supported output formats: nquads, trig, rdfxml
code: # Export to N-Quads format output <- rdf_serialize(store, format = "nquads") cat(substr(output, 1, 500), "...\n") #> <http://example.org/carol> <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/age> "28"^^<http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#integer> . #> <http://example.org/carol> <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Carol" . #> <http://example.org/carol> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person> . #> <http://example.org/bob> <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/age> "25"^^<http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#integer> . #> <http://example.org/bob> <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Bob" . #> <http://example.org/bob> <http:/ ...

title: Getting Started with roxigraph
text: Use prefixes SPARQL queries readability Choose right storage: -memory temporary data, persistent large datasets Batch operations: Use rdf_load() bulk data rather individual rdf_add() calls Close persistent stores: R handle cleanup, explicit management helps large databases

title: Getting Started with roxigraph

what: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: roxigraph provides RDF storage SPARQL 1.1 query capabilities R wrapping Oxigraph graph database library. Built using extendr framework high-performance Rust-R bindings.

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: ðŸš€ High Performance: Rust-powered RDF storage RocksDB backend ðŸ’¾ Flexible Storage: -memory persistent -disk databases ðŸ“„ Multiple Formats: Turtle, N-Triples, RDF-XML, N-Quads, TriG ðŸ” Full SPARQL 1.1: Query Update support

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: Install pre-built binaries r-universe:
code: install.packages("roxigraph", repos = c("https://cboettig.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: binary installation Ubuntu (Rust required):
code: # Set up r-universe binary repo for Linux repo <- sprintf(   "https://cboettig.r-universe.dev/bin/linux/noble-%s/%s/",   R.version$arch, substr(getRversion(), 1, 3) ) install.packages("roxigraph", repos = c(repo, "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: Building source requires: - Rust toolchain (rustc >= 1.65, cargo) - libclang-dev (RocksDB bindings Linux) Ubuntu/Debian:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("cboettig/roxigraph") # Install Rust curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh  # Install libclang sudo apt-get install libclang-dev

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
code: library(roxigraph)  # Create an in-memory store store <- rdf_store()  # Load some RDF data (Turtle format) rdf_load(store, ' @prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> . @prefix ex: <http://example.org/> .  ex:alice foaf:name "Alice" ;          foaf:knows ex:bob . ex:bob foaf:name "Bob" . ', format = "turtle")  # Query with SPARQL sparql_query(store, "   PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>   SELECT ?name WHERE { ?person foaf:name ?name }   ORDER BY ?name ") #>      name #> 1 "Alice" #> 2   "Bob"  # Check store size rdf_size(store) #> [1] 3

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: data persist across R sessions:
code: # Create a persistent store store <- rdf_store("/path/to/my/database")  # Data is automatically persisted to disk rdf_load(store, data, format = "turtle")

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: Modify data using SPARQL Update:
code: store <- rdf_store()  # Insert data sparql_update(store, "   INSERT DATA {     <http://example.org/alice> <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> 'Alice' .   } ")  # Query the inserted data sparql_query(store, "SELECT * WHERE { ?s ?p ?o }") #>         o                                p                          s #> 1 "Alice" <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> <http://example.org/alice>

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: Export RDF data various formats:
code: store <- rdf_store() rdf_load(store, '<http://ex.org/s> <http://ex.org/p> "hello" .', format = "ntriples")  # Serialize to N-Quads cat(rdf_serialize(store, format = "nquads")) #> <http://ex.org/s> <http://ex.org/p> "hello" .

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: Package documentation Oxigraph - underlying Rust library SPARQL 1.1 specification

title: RDF and SPARQL for R using Oxigraph
text: MIT Â© Carl Boettiger Oxigraph dual-licensed MIT/Apache-2.0.

title: Add a Triple â€” rdf_add
text: Adds single triple store.

title: Add a Triple â€” rdf_add
code: rdf_add(store, subject, predicate, object, graph = NULL)

title: Add a Triple â€” rdf_add
text: store RDF store handle subject Subject IRI (e.g., "<http://example.org/s>") blank node ("_:b1") predicate Predicate IRI (e.g., "<http://example.org/p>") object Object: IRI, blank node, literal (e.g., '"value"') graph Optional named graph IRI

title: Add a Triple â€” rdf_add
text: Invisibly returns NULL

title: Add a Triple â€” rdf_add
code: store <- rdf_store() rdf_add(store, "<http://example.org/s>", "<http://example.org/p>", '"hello"') rdf_size(store) #> [1] 1

title: Load RDF Data â€” rdf_load
text: Loads RDF data store string.

title: Load RDF Data â€” rdf_load
code: rdf_load(store, data, format = "turtle", base_iri = NULL)

title: Load RDF Data â€” rdf_load
text: store RDF store handle data RDF data character string format RDF format: "turtle", "ntriples", "rdfxml", "nquads", "trig" base_iri Optional base IRI resolving relative URIs

title: Load RDF Data â€” rdf_load
text: Invisibly returns NULL

title: Load RDF Data â€” rdf_load
code: store <- rdf_store() rdf_load(store, '<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> "value" .', format = "ntriples")

what: Load RDF from File â€” rdf_load_file
title: Load RDF from File â€” rdf_load_file
text: Loads RDF data store file.

title: Load RDF from File â€” rdf_load_file
code: rdf_load_file(store, file, format = NULL, base_iri = NULL)

title: Load RDF from File â€” rdf_load_file
text: store RDF store handle file Path RDF file format RDF format. NULL, guessed file extension. base_iri Optional base IRI resolving relative URIs

title: Load RDF from File â€” rdf_load_file
text: Invisibly returns NULL

title: Load RDF from File â€” rdf_load_file
code: store <- rdf_store() # Create a temporary RDF file tmp <- tempfile(fileext = ".nt") writeLines('<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> "value" .', tmp) rdf_load_file(store, tmp) rdf_size(store) #> [1] 1

title: Remove a Triple â€” rdf_remove
text: Removes single triple store.

title: Remove a Triple â€” rdf_remove
code: rdf_remove(store, subject, predicate, object, graph = NULL)

title: Remove a Triple â€” rdf_remove
text: store RDF store handle subject Subject IRI blank node predicate Predicate IRI object Object: IRI, blank node, literal graph Optional named graph IRI

title: Remove a Triple â€” rdf_remove
text: Invisibly returns NULL

title: Remove a Triple â€” rdf_remove
code: store <- rdf_store() rdf_add(store, "<http://example.org/s>", "<http://example.org/p>", '"hello"') rdf_remove(store, "<http://example.org/s>", "<http://example.org/p>", '"hello"') rdf_size(store) #> [1] 0

title: Serialize RDF Data â€” rdf_serialize
text: Serializes store contents string.

title: Serialize RDF Data â€” rdf_serialize
code: rdf_serialize(store, format = "turtle")

title: Serialize RDF Data â€” rdf_serialize
text: store RDF store handle format RDF format: "turtle", "ntriples", "rdfxml", "nquads", "trig"

title: Serialize RDF Data â€” rdf_serialize
text: serialized RDF data character string

title: Serialize RDF Data â€” rdf_serialize
code: store <- rdf_store() rdf_load(store, '<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> "value" .', format = "ntriples") rdf_serialize(store, format = "turtle") #> [1] "<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> \"value\" .\n"

title: Get Store Size â€” rdf_size
text: Returns number quads (triples) store.

title: Get Store Size â€” rdf_size
code: rdf_size(store)

title: Get Store Size â€” rdf_size
text: store RDF store handle

title: Get Store Size â€” rdf_size
text: number quads integer

title: Get Store Size â€” rdf_size
code: store <- rdf_store() rdf_size(store) #> [1] 0

what: Create an RDF Store â€” rdf_store
title: Create an RDF Store â€” rdf_store
text: Creates new RDF store, either -memory backed persistent storage.

title: Create an RDF Store â€” rdf_store
code: rdf_store(path = NULL)

title: Create an RDF Store â€” rdf_store
text: path Optional path persistent storage. NULL (default), creates -memory store.

title: Create an RDF Store â€” rdf_store
text: RDF store handle (integer)

title: Create an RDF Store â€” rdf_store
code: # In-memory store store <- rdf_store()  # Persistent store (not supported on Windows) # \donttest{ if (.Platform$OS.type != "windows") {   store <- rdf_store(file.path(tempdir(), "my_store")) } # }

what: Serialize the store contents to a string â€” rdf_store_dump
title: Serialize the store contents to a string â€” rdf_store_dump
text: Serialize store contents string

title: Serialize the store contents to a string â€” rdf_store_dump
code: rdf_store_dump(store_idx, format)

title: Serialize the store contents to a string â€” rdf_store_dump
text: store_idx Store index format RDF format: "turtle", "ntriples", "rdfxml", "nquads", "trig"

title: Serialize the store contents to a string â€” rdf_store_dump
text: serialized RDF data

title: Serialize the store contents to a string â€” rdf_store_dump
code: store <- rdf_store_new() rdf_store_load(store, '<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> "v" .', "ntriples", NULL) rdf_store_dump(store, "turtle") #> [1] "<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> \"v\" .\n"

title: Insert a triple into the store â€” rdf_store_insert
text: store_idx Store index subject Subject IRI (e.g., "<http://example.org/s>") blank node ("_:b1") predicate Predicate IRI (e.g., "<http://example.org/p>") object Object (IRI, blank node, literal quotes e.g., "\"value\"") graph Optional graph name IRI

what: Execute a SPARQL query and return results as a data frame â€” rdf_store_query

title: Execute a SPARQL query and return results as a data frame â€” rdf_store_query
text: store_idx Store index query SPARQL query string

title: Execute a SPARQL query and return results as a data frame â€” rdf_store_query
text: Query results data frame (SELECT) logical (ASK)

title: Execute a SPARQL query and return results as a data frame â€” rdf_store_query
code: store <- rdf_store_new() rdf_store_load(store, '<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> "v" .', "ntriples", NULL) rdf_store_query(store, "SELECT * WHERE { ?s ?p ?o }") #>     o                      p                      s #> 1 "v" <http://example.org/p> <http://example.org/s>

text: store_idx Store index update SPARQL UPDATE query string

title: Execute a SPARQL UPDATE query â€” rdf_store_update
text: return value, called side effects (executing SPARQL UPDATE queries)

title: Execute a SPARQL UPDATE query â€” rdf_store_update
code: store <- rdf_store_new() rdf_store_update(store, "INSERT DATA { <http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> 'val' }")

what: roxigraph: RDF and SPARQL for R â€” roxigraph-package
title: roxigraph: RDF and SPARQL for R â€” roxigraph-package
text: Provides RDF storage SPARQL 1.1 query capabilities wrapping 'Oxigraph' graph database library. Supports -memory persistent ('RocksDB') storage, multiple RDF serialization formats, full SPARQL 1.1 Query Update support.

title: roxigraph: RDF and SPARQL for R â€” roxigraph-package
text: rdf_store: Create RDF store rdf_load: Load RDF data sparql_query: Execute SPARQL queries sparql_update: Execute SPARQL updates rdf_serialize: Serialize RDF data

title: roxigraph: RDF and SPARQL for R â€” roxigraph-package
text: Maintainer: Carl Boettiger cboettig@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Authors dependency Rust crates (see inst/AUTHORS file) contributors: Oxigraph Contributors (Oxigraph Rust library) [copyright holder]

what: Execute a SPARQL Query â€” sparql_query
title: Execute a SPARQL Query â€” sparql_query
text: Executes SPARQL query RDF store.

title: Execute a SPARQL Query â€” sparql_query
code: sparql_query(store, query)

title: Execute a SPARQL Query â€” sparql_query
text: store RDF store handle query SPARQL query string

title: Execute a SPARQL Query â€” sparql_query
text: SELECT queries, data.frame results. ASK queries, logical. CONSTRUCT/DESCRIBE queries, data.frame subject, predicate, object columns.

title: Execute a SPARQL Query â€” sparql_query
code: store <- rdf_store() rdf_load(store, '<http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> "hello" .', format = "ntriples") sparql_query(store, "SELECT * WHERE { ?s ?p ?o }") #>         o                      p                      s #> 1 "hello" <http://example.org/p> <http://example.org/s>

title: Execute SPARQL Update â€” sparql_update
text: Executes SPARQL UPDATE query modify store.

title: Execute SPARQL Update â€” sparql_update
code: sparql_update(store, update)

title: Execute SPARQL Update â€” sparql_update
text: store RDF store handle update SPARQL UPDATE query string

title: Execute SPARQL Update â€” sparql_update
text: Invisibly returns NULL

title: Execute SPARQL Update â€” sparql_update
code: store <- rdf_store() sparql_update(store, "INSERT DATA { <http://example.org/s> <http://example.org/p> 'value' }")

title: roxigraph 0.1.1
text: Fixed Rust version compatibility pinning oxigraph dependency 0.5.2, ensuring support Rust 1.70.0+ (resolving issues newer oxigraph requiring bleeding-edge Rust). Added libsnappy-dev SystemRequirements RocksDB compression support.
